In the later rounds a new obstacle appears; tiles that only allow movement in one direction. One wrong move and you'll get stuck.

It should also be taken into account that only one item can be carried each time, and it cannot be dropped. That is why it is very important to make the right decision about which monster you want to defeat with the object that you now have in your possession. Otherwise, you can not grab the next object, because you do not have the right one to beat the monster that stands in front of it.

In some rounds, instead of picking up keys, you can also rescue women who are surrounded by the monsters. When you take a woman to the door, she will be very grateful. You will then be rewarded with an erotic image.

An editor is included, where you can make your own rounds.

The follow-up of the game, グリエルの聖杯 エクセレント (The Holy Grail of Griel Excellent) was published in Peach Up Special 1991 and in 2005, a MSX1 remake of the first game, Quest for the Sangraal was made for the MSXdev '05 coding contest.

* バグ修正プログラム (Bug fixes):

This program can fix the bugs of the vertical scroll shooting game 究極ピーチ (Ultimate Peach) of Peach Up 3.

* ピーチ・ギャラリー (Peach Gallery):

A CG gallery of erotic images of naked girls that were send in by users.

Disk 2:

* OUTER LIMITS番外編 ピコポンぬいでぬいでゲーム (Outer Limits Bangai-hen: Pikopon Nuide Nuide Game):

In this game, with the girls of the Outer Limits RPG, you have to compare the outcome of the math problem above your character's head versus the one above the girl's, but if the answer is a higher number than the opponent you can hit her head with a mallet, before she blocks it with a shield. She can do it to you as well, though. At each 3 bonks, more of the girl in her naked state to be revealed. However, if you lose, this will happen to you.

* シェナン・ドラゴン (Shenan Dragon):

This is a trailer of the RPG Shenan Dragon.

* Mailbox

Answering the questions of users.

* 編集後記 (Editor's Note)

sample_screenshots.caption: シェナン・ドラゴン; Introducing one of the characters; Brave Woman (女の勇敢)
グリエルの聖杯; Menu Screen
OUTER LIMITS番外編 ピコポンぬいでぬいでゲーム (Outer Limits Bangai-hen: You've won the first round, so the first part of the girl in her naked state will be revealed.
グリエルの聖杯; Loading Screen

title: Peach Up 4

description: RADX-8 is a shooter where the player, like in Laydock, flies over the surface of planets and tries to shoot down all enemies or just evade them. The player starts with 300 ammunition but must be very careful not to run out of ammo in the later levels. When a next level is reached, the player receives a bonus game if a certain score has been achieved, this score is different per level. After the tenth level, the game starts again with the opponents of the first level.
title: RADX-8

description:
Duck Hunt is a shooting simulation where the player goes out with his faithful dogs to hunt ducks. It requires the use of the Zapper light gun. In game modes A and B, players view a swampland from a first-person perspective. The dog scares the ducks out of the swamp, one at a time in mode A or two at a time in mode B. The ducks go flying around in the air and the player has three shots and a limited amount of time to shoot the ducks before they fly away. Each round only allows a limited number of misses in order to move on successfully. As the rounds progress, the ducks begin flying faster and faster, and fewer misses are allowed. In game mode A, a second player can control the movement of the duck using a controller plugged into port 2.

Mode C features target practice on clay pigeons rather than ducks. The perspective and rules here are the same, with only three shots to destroy two clay pigeons before they disappear off the horizon. Destroy enough clay pigeons to move on to the next, tougher round.
title: Duck Hunt

description: An unofficial port of the Game Boy game Daedalian Opus. It was created for the game development contest MSXdev'06. While retaining the same gameplay as the Game Boy version it takes advantage of being on the MSX by utilizing a color display.

sample_screenshots.caption: After completion, you receive a password

title: Daedalian Opus

description:
There used to be a small island beyond the south of the town where you live. The name of the island is animals paradise Animal Land. One day, a murder case occurred in this quiet and peaceful village of peace. The victim is the owner of the Concon Jewelry Store, the fox Gonkichi. You received a report and started investigating with the police dog Oidon.

The game plays out similarly to Portopia Satsujin Renzoku Jiken and others similar detective games. You select various commands in the menu to investigate crime scenes and quiz suspects.
title: Animal Land Satsujin Jiken

description:
FD Konami Collection is a compilation of games themed after Snatcher and SD Snatcher which had previously appeared in issues of the Future Disk disk magazine. It contains:

  • Junker Squad, a light gun-style game using graphics based on SD Snatcher. The player controls a Junker agent and must shoot as many snatchers as possible. Previously released in issue 15.
  • Street Snatch, a one-on-one action game using graphics based on SD Snatcher. The player controls Gillian Seed in a faceoff with a single snatcher. Previously released in issue 17.
  • Mika Slayton Poker, a poker game using graphics from Snatcher. The player controls Gillian Seed against a CPU-controlled Mika Slayton. Previously released in issue 27.
title: FD Konami Collection

description:
Congratulations on your marriage. But you probably should have told your new wife about the spiders. Oh well. I'm sure you'll have all that sorted out by the the time she arrives home...

Pico Pico is primarily an action game set on a single screen which shows a top-down view of you and your "house". This is a loose collection of bricks that can be shifted by pushing them or firing into them. Suck spiders start invading from the edge of your property, and you must shoot them before they shoot you. The spider's dead bodies can provide extra material for your house. After the first wave of 30 spiders has been killed, your bride arrives, and you receive bonus points for the size of your house. The next wave of spiders then arrives, but now you must also protect your wife. This can be done by surrounding her with bricks, dead spiders, and "stoppers" which you can drop in an empty space in front of you. If you or your wife get shot, you lose a life. After every 30 spiders killed, you receive a bonus, as well as a small amount of time to prepare for the next wave.

sample_screenshots.caption: After attacks by 8 spiders, the house needs some work.
Your wife (pink) has arrived and is inspecting the patio.
Your wife is safe in the house, but is now a widow.
Your house is nicely arranged at the start of the game.

title: Pico Pico

description: Magical Kid Wiz is a side-scrolling action game where you play a kid who needs to rescue a captured princess. Many types of attacks can be chosen to target and defeat the many enemies, but these need to be located and collected first. There are multiple stages and the game keeps track of the high score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Find books to collect new spells.
That door leads to the castle.
Inside the same castle, but with different walls.

title: Magical Kid Wiz

description: Anty is an arcade game where players control termites. The objective of the game is to eat all the branches of the trees on the map. Players must watch out for dangerous obstacles such as ponds or people who shoot pesticides that can kill them. Bonus items can be gathered to achieve a high score.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is where you start the game.
These people walking around spray pesticides at you. Sometimes it's better to jump off the tree than try to dodge them.
Your job is to eat some wood and drop all the tree branches.
Watch where you stand, otherwise, you can fall with the branch to your death.

title: Anty

description: Ninja is an Action Role-Playing Game taking place in a fictional world modeled after Japan at the end of the 16th century. The country is divided by two forces on the east and the west. The player becomes a ninja that belongs to the west clan and needs to gather more information about the enemy movement and help his forces conquer the country. All battles are done in real time with the ninja attacking enemies using his Katana.

sample_screenshots.caption: Talking to an NPC. Note that all text is shown vertically in this game.

title: Ninja

description:
Computer Othello is an implementation of the classic two-player board game. The board is an 8x8 square on which white and black tokens are placed. The starting position has two tokens of each colour diagonally opposite in the central 2x2 square. Black then places a token so that there is now one or more lines (of one or more consecutive white tokens) between the placed token and another black token. These lines can be either horizontally, vertically or diagonally, and results in all of those tokens being flipped to black. The same rule applies when white plays to flip black tokens. Players alternate placing single tokens at a time, and must flip a token each turn. Only if no legal move is available can they pass. The aim is to have the most tokens of your colour before both players need to pass.

This version of othello allows play against the computer, with up to four skill levels. There is also a view button for beginners to show what squares allow legal token placement.

sample_screenshots.caption: Allows setting skill level and choice of colour.
Red markers show legal moves for white.

title: Computer Othello

description:
Theseus is a smooth scrolling platform game inspired by the maze portion of the arcade game Major Havoc. In each level, the titular character is trapped in a labyrinth, and must find a ring and a key before rescuing his girlfriend.

The labyrinth is oriented vertically, and must be traversed by running and jumping. Theseus can jump any distance vertically while holding down the jump button, and can maneuver in mid-air. Obstacles within the maze include lava and invulnerable creatures whose touch reduce the players vitality. There is also a time-limit for completion of the level. Having either the time or vitality reduced to zero causes the loss of the game. These can be replenished by collecting various objects scattered throughout the maze. There are also switches that open and close walls to aid (or hinder) progress.

sample_screenshots.caption: The auto-play shows the wall can be opened by standing here.

title: Theseus

description: Illegus Episode IV is a first person maze game inspired by 3D Monster Maze. Your task is to make your way out of the 10 labyrinths of the planet Al-Mazar. The mazes are patrolled by robot guards. Contact with the guards is fatal, but they can be shot and killed. Warning of a nearby guard is sounded by an increase in the monotonic humming produced by a detector which you carry. Also within the maze are a variety of objects: gold, food, water and an infra-red viewer. The viewer is useful at night, when the maze would be otherwise invisible in the darkness. Later mazes also contain pits which can be jumped.

sample_screenshots.caption: The infra-red viewer allows you to see at night.
A patrolling robot is just behind the corner.

title: Illegus Episode IV

description:
Warrior is a top-down dungeon crawler, where the goal is to defeat a dragon in its lair located in the south-east area of the maze. To become strong enough to defeat the dragon, you need to pick-up various power-ups (denoted by question marks) scattered throughout the dungeon. These provide random increases (or sometimes decreases) to various statistics such as Strength, Hit Points, Attack Points, Armour Class and Money.

At certain fixed squares of the maze, monsters will appear and slowly chase you. If you are caught, you are taken to a combat screen where the battle is automatically played out. Each round of combat uses a point of Strength. If you lose the round, you will be damaged which causes a reduction in Armor Class or Hit Points. You are then given the option of continuing combat. Alternatively, you may win the round and cause some amount of damage to your opponent related to Attack Points. If your opponent is killed, you will usually gain Experience points, although later in the game you will sometimes lose points for a kill.

The game is lost if your Strength or Hit Points are reduced below zero, but you win if you gain sufficiently high statistics and confront the dragon for the final battle.
title: Warrior

description:
Ultraman is an action game based on the 1960s Japanese TV series of the same name. In each level, you control forces defending a convoy of military equipment from marauding monsters. The first part of the level involves protecting a ship containing airplanes from flying saucers and sea-monsters. You control an aircraft which fires guns straight ahead when it is in the top half of the screen, and drops bombs when at the lower half of the screen. If you are hit, or if a plane from the ship is beamed-up by a saucer, or smashed by a monster, you lose a life. Once the ship has arrived at its destination, the second half of the level begins.

The second half of each level consists of a convoy of trucks moving towards the left of the screen, pursued by a giant monster from the TV series (such as Red King, a giant lizard that throws rocks, or Alien Baltan, a purple humanoid lobster-like creature). The progress of the convoy is shown at the bottom of the screen. Again, you start in a plane and can defend the convoy by attacking the monster's legs causing it to trip. Alternatively, you can land the plane ahead of the monster, and activate the beta capsule to summon Ultraman. The game then becomes a beat-em-up, where Ultraman can walk, jump, punch and kick the opponent while your monstrous opponent tries to do the same to you. If the monster destroys a truck, then you lose a life. But once you have given the trucks enough time to reach their destination, you are able to activate your spacium ray which permanently disables your opponents. The levels then repeat until you have run out of lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: The ship just leaving dock with its cargo of three planes.
Nearly arrived, but a plane is being captured by a saucer.

title: Ultraman

description:
Kid Tawara has discovered the wreck of a ship carrying diamonds. His goal is to find one diamond hidden in a grain bag on each of four floors of the ship, before the wreck completely submerges beneath the waves. Of course, the ship is haunted. Spirit fires drift around the ship, and sometimes manifest as ghosts that will kill Tawara on contact. While the ghosts move slowly, Tawara's movement can be blocked by grain bags and larger spice barrels, which he needs to move before he can get anywhere. On the plus side, Tawara can throw grain bags at the ghosts to subdue them. Each throw costs energy though, and so only a limited number of throws are possible.

It is also possible for Tawara to explore the decks that are already underwater, but he has only a limited time before his oxygen runs out and he loses a life. On later levels, the submerged decks may be patrolled by sharks. The rise of the water can be slowed by closing the hatches between levels, but eventually the pressure builds causing the hatches to re-open.

There are a total of four levels of difficulty, and each difficulty has four screens.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start of level 1. So far, so good.
Too late! The ship has completely submerged.

title: Tawara

description:
Pig Mock is an action game where you, Pig Mock, must catch dropped eggs and transfer them to funnels at the side of the screen. The eggs are dropped by Thunder Pants who are some creatures living in the clouds. Pig Mock has a frying pan with which to collect the eggs, Pressing up allows the eggs to be thrown upwards, and any Thunder Pants hit by a red egg will fall from the cloud, before eventually being replaced. Dropped eggs will stay on the floor, until cleaned up by Uncle Dust-pan who periodically crosses the screen, eating the smashed eggs. After eating enough eggs, Uncle Dust-pan will grow in size and cannot be jumped.

Each round of Pig Mock is concluded when 15 eggs have been collected. To make matters more difficult, there are mounds on the floor which can cause Pig Mock to trip and become momentarily dazed. Later levels also have a mole which attacks from below the ground. Pig Mock may dispatch the mole by hitting them with the frying pan once they are above ground. Contact with Uncle Dust-pan or the mole, or being hit by an egg will cause Pig Mock to lose a life. The rounds increase in difficulty by changing the number of mounds, the number of clouds containing Thunder Pants, and the tenaciousness of the mole.

sample_screenshots.caption: Uncle Dust-pan has grown to big to be jumped.
A Thunder Pant falling after being hit by a red egg.

title: Pig Mock

description:
Skooter is a top-down puzzle game with gameplay similarities to Sokoban and Pac-Man. Players control a small unicycled-styled robot who must collect various objects while avoiding four invulnerable tank-treaded robots and making use of special blocks and tiles. The game uses a standard arcade-style high score and life system.

The blocks seen in the vary in use, ability, and design. While most act merely as walls, some are able to be moved around by the player in simple directions which can used to access parts of the level and trap enemies. Some blocks merely disappear when touched by the player, allowing both them and enemies to access more of the level. Occasionally, a heart may appear out of these either of these blocks which, upon collection, will grant the player a short period of invincibility and allow them to knock enemies out of the playing area. Another feature in almost every level are special tiles that force the player to move in a fixed direction, though can be defeated if a block is placed in front of its directional output.

The goal is to collect four objects located around parts of each level. While the number objects never change, the theme of each the objects change after every two levels and include food, electronics, letters, weapons, and other forms of iconography. After each level, the player is rewarded with random quotes and anecdotes, all of which have no meaning to the game itself. There are sixteen levels/puzzles in total.
title: Skooter

description:
Koi-Koi is a traditional Japanese two-player card game. It is played with the hanafuda, which is a flower themed deck consisting of four cards in each of twelve suits corresponding to months of the year. The aim is to capture certain combinations, known as yaku, using cards played from the hand you are dealt, and picked up from the table.

Each round starts with eight cards placed face up on the table, and eight dealt to each player. The first player must play a card to the table. If it matches the same suit as an existing table card, then both it and the played card are captured by that player. A new card is then drawn from the deck and immediately played to the table. Again, if this matches, the player captures that card, and it is then the opponent's move. The first player to make a yaku can choose to win the hand, or say "Koi koi" to continue the game. If a second yaku is completed before your opponent, you win double points. Otherwise, your opponent wins double points, and a new hand is dealt.

If no player completes a yaku when their cards run out, a point score is calculated from each player's captured cards and the player with the higher score wins the round and gains a point. The winner of the previous round then plays first in the next round. Play continues for 12 rounds (one for each month of the year), after which the player with the highest score wins.

This implementation of the game automatically detects when different yaku have been played, and does the scoring for you. It also has only one fairly low level of difficulty for the computer opponent, allowing a novice to win the game even if they imperfectly recognize the cards and can't remember all of the yaku.

sample_screenshots.caption: Selecting one of two matches to my play of the left-most card.

title: Hanafuda Koi-Koi

description:
Boogie Woogi Jungle is an action game, where your character must collect a number of objects scattered around each screen before the timer runs out. Most of the objects are on ledges, requiring climbing up ladders and across rope bridges. Other characters are also running around the screen, and must be avoided to prevent losing a life. Graphically and game-play wise, it is very similar to Lode Runner, except that instead of digging holes to temporarily trap your pursuers, you can fire either horizontally or vertically to stun them.

There are a total of 15 levels, with a couple of cut-scenes showing a house along with an encouraging message. After the final level is complete, the game loops back to the beginning.
title: Boogie Woogi Jungle

description: Inca I is a platform game with clear reminiscences to Manic Miner. The action takes place through 50 levels set in the territory that once belonged to the Inca Empire. The character must go through them collecting the 150 gold nuggets necessary to complete the adventure, while making millimeter jumps and dodging carnivorous plants, indigenous repetitive movements, skulls, arrows, etc.

sample_screenshots.caption: Inca is loading. Copyright and Credits.
There are also moving platforms that can cushion the player's fall or make it possible to reach some area that cannot be reached by jumping. Watch out for those rocks!

title: Inca I

description:
It's war, and you are a gunner in a fortified gun emplacement, or pillbox. Your position at the top of the screen is slowly being over-run by soldiers, who are creeping up on you from the bottom of the screen, and taking cover behind rows of sand-bags. Once the enemy gets past the final row, they will destroy your base with a grenade, so you will need to shoot them before that happens. You control the cross-hairs of a gun, and must take aim and fire at the soldiers when they are crawling between the sandbags, which is the only time they are exposed. Occasionally, the leader of the troops briefly appears at the bottom of the screen to encourage their troops. Shooting the leader will cause all of the remaining troops to surrender, and the next wave to begin.

The difficulty increases for the later waves, when the troops start crawling faster, and vehicles will sometimes appear which deliver soldiers closer to your pillbox.

sample_screenshots.caption: A soldier has destroyed the pillbox.
Soldiers are closing in on the pillbox.
The leader has appeared at the bottom right.

title: Pill Box

description:
Players take on the role of Alan "Dutch" Schaefer as he fights rebels in a Guatemalan jungle. Of course there is something even more terrifying than the rebels out there that Dutch will have to contend with.

Dutch is armed with a machine gun, grenades and mines. Use of these weapons will consume them, but defeated enemies will occasionally drop ammo refills. Dutch has a health meter so he can take a couple of hits from enemies before he forfeits his life. Dutch starts with six lives and can find extra lives throughout the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: You need some practice for these jumps

title: Predator

description:
In Zoo, the player takes the role of a local employee of the animal welfare organisation HAED (Hulp Aan Eenzame Dieren), who has heard from a reliable source that something strange is going on at the local zoo. The zoo management is secretly buying new animals, and nobody seems to know what happened to the old animals. After gather enough evidence through talking to people and finding clues, the player can then arrest the right culprit with an arrest warrant.

This graphical adventure game in Dutch can be played by keyboard, joystick and supports mouse control.

sample_screenshots.caption: At the counter of the bank.

title: Zoo

description:
Mr. Chin is a Chinese circus performer who specializes in balancing spinning plates on poles. Each stage consists of three levels with seven poles on each level, and Mr. Chin must demonstrate his acrobatic skills by spinning dishes on all of the poles at once. An unappreciative critic tries to thwart Mr.Chin by throwing cutlery at him from off-stage which he must avoid by either jumping or ducking. The frequency at which these objects are thrown increases for later stages. From stage 4, gaps in the floor appear and move about which will cause the circus star to fall. From stage 10, the levels wrap back to the beginning.

To set a dish spinning, Mr. Chin must first collect a dish from the side of the screen which he carries this on his head. He then climbs an empty pole, and once at the top the dish is placed and spun. Each dish will only spin for a limited time before it starts to wobble more and more wildly before eventually falling. These dishes can be re-spun by climbing to the top of the pole again. A broken dish is a calamity for the perfectionist Mr. Chin, but he gamely continues his performances, although three mishaps are enough to ruin his career.
title: Mr. Ching

description:
In The Stone of Wisdom you play as Leon, who is transported to a mysterious castle and told to retrieve four ancient tablets so he can go back home. After each tablet, you move on to a different part of the castle where the walls and floor are a different colour and the enemies are tougher.

Your only weapon is a sword, which you use to stab enemies. These don't really attack you but wander back and forth, hurting you when they collide with you. They are mostly what gives the game an Egyptian flair, as you can recognise mummies, sphinxes and the classic hieroglyphic representation of a man in profile, along with some more abstract creatures.

Special blocks can be destroyed to reveal gems that increase your three coloured gauges: black Intelligence (secret doors open when this stat reaches certain thresholds), red Power (making your attacks stronger) and blue Life (you will lose if it drops to zero). You also need to avoid contact with three types of coloured squares, which deplete the corresponding gauge if you walk over them. You can also pick up orbs, which serve as currency to purchase upgrades that nullify the harmful squares, raise your attack or defence, etc.

To progress through the castle, you will often need to reveal news paths by destroying walls, and these are not indicated in any way. However, once you know where to look, the game can be completed in very little time. Once you have reached the end, you will be given the option to restart from the beginning, retaining all your items and stats, making the second run through trivial. Once that is done, you have actually beaten the game.

With its hack and slash and light RPG elements, secrets to be found and sometimes maze-like structure, The Stone of Wisdom is in the vein of 1984 The Tower of Druaga and emulates to a degree the dungeons of The Legend of Zelda, released earlier the same year, although in a much more stripped-down version, since there are no bosses, no items to use and a limited variety of enemies.

sample_screenshots.caption: A room of enemies and lava
The blue area and its red blobs

title: The Stone of Wisdom

description: Trial Ski is a downhill skiing game where you must direct your character between the flags and reach the finish line while gravity propels you down a snow covered slope. Not only must you keep to the track, which gets increasingly more narrow and jagged at higher levels, but you must also avoid rock-piles before reaching the finish line. You are only allowed to miss a few flags per level. And although hitting the rocks is not an automatic loss, it does cause a delay. You are only allowed three failures to complete the tracks within the specified time before your game is over.
title: Trial Ski

description:
Planet Tiar is in crisis. The sunspots of this distant Earth-like planet's sun are disrupting its climate, and now evil invaders are taking advantage of this situation to try and conquer Tiar. The planet sends a distress signal to Earth, calling for a hero to fight the invader and save them. From the deep sea to the far reaches of space, it's up to you to fight and make sure Tiar does not fall.

Hydefos is a shoot 'em up with smooth scrolling, a rarity on the MSX, where the scrolling is usually choppy, and a feat developer Hertz had already accomplished on a previous title, action platformer Psychic World. You pilot one of five ships through levels featuring branching paths, so two play-throughs could be different depending on where you go.

You have a health bar, and you only die if it drops to zero or you collide with a wall. You can pick up various items that increase/decrease your speed, add guns to your ship (sometimes with the ability to rotate them to shoot up, down or behind you), give you a shield for defense, etc. The environment can also be a hazard, with walls that materialize only when shot and obstacles that need to be shot in order to pass safely.

You will regularly come across a "pit stop", where you can dock to change ships and loadout. You can also choose to bypass it and keep your current vessel. You will have to defeat four bosses before taking on the final one. Interestingly, you do not kill him, but rather catch up to him and capture him while he flees in his own ship.

sample_screenshots.caption: Switching ships at a pit stop ("Here we are")
Careful where you shoot, or you might create new obstacles for yourself
It's useful to be able to fire up or down when navigating treacherous areas

title: Hydefos

description:
The Golf is halfway between arcade and realism, closer to Nintendo's Golf than Artdink's full golf career simulator Double Eagle, which was released later the same year.

In this game, you can embark solo on three different tournaments versus AI players, play a match against a human opponent, or bet against up to three other human players in a Skins Game.

The actual gameplay is split into two different screens: you start from a top-down perspective where you can see the whole course, which gives you the opportunity to swivel your player around towards where you want the ball to go, followed by a 3D-like third-person view where you actually aim and hit the ball, with a classic power meter. Other elements will affect the ball's trajectory, such as the wind's direction and strength, as well as the curvature of the ground. You will also have to watch out for trees, sand bunkers and trees.

sample_screenshots.caption: Winding up for a big shot
The three tournaments you can play through

title: The Golf

description:
Lupin III is a cat-burglar character who originally appeared in Japanese manga. The current entry was inspired by the anime "Castle of Cagliostro" in which Lupin steals some money that turns out to be counterfeit. He tracks the source of the fake money to a castle, and finds that it is inhabited by an evil count who has kidnapped a young woman and forcing her to marry him so that he can control the Cagliostro fortune.

The game is a platformer with seven levels, and features many of the same locations that appear in the anime. You control Lupin, and your goal in each stage is to find a red and a green ring, and bring them to a goat's head mounted on the wall to open the secret exit to the next level. In addition to the typical walking and jumping controls, Lupin has several attacks: a short range sword strike, a long range gun shot (if you have enough bullets) and a flash-bomb which is triggered while jumping, and destroys all enemies on the screen. Special items, such as the rings, can be found in niches which Lupin can break open with his sword. Some of the niches are hidden.

In addition to the rings, there are other items that can be found in niches, or occasionally dropped by defeated foes. There is ammo for your gun, a shirt that gives you temporary invincibility, rockets which can be used to launch a rope to access higher parts of the level, as well as goggles which hinder your ability to move. On some levels, a lady occasionally runs across the screen, and if you have a coin when she runs past, you will receive an item in return.

Most of the items found are cups. These add to a special slider at the top of the screen, and When you pick up a tea pot, the cup statistic is converted into life energy. Energy is lost by touching enemies, or traps such as falling chandeliers. When your energy reaches zero, the game is over. A password is shown at the end of each completed level, allowing you to start where you left off without having to replay the entire game.

sample_screenshots.caption: More of your allies are shown for later stages.
Using the password to reach Stage 3 gives this cut scene.

title: Lupin Sansei: Cagliostro no Shiro

description: David II is a simple vertically scrolling shoot-em-up consisting of a single endless level. Planes of various colours and movement styles appear from the top of the screen and try to shoot you out of the sky. You try to return the favour. All enemy aircraft only require a single shot to be destroyed, and do not get faster or any more difficult the longer you play the game. If you are correctly lined up, you can shoot incoming enemy bullets before they reach you.

sample_screenshots.caption: The ships are only part of the background.

title: David II

description:
You are in a building with ladders between floors. Each floor also contains entrances to a number of rooms, which may contain documents. Your aim is to collect five of these documents and then escape to the roof, after which you move to the next scene where the process is repeated.

Two agents have been sent to thwart your progress, and will follow you mercilessly. If they catch you, you will lose a life. But they can be temporarily immobilized by picking up then using one of the fire extinguishers that are scattered around the building.

Points are earned by collecting papers, knocking over adversaries or visiting a kitchen. Points will be lost if you walk into a toilet.

sample_screenshots.caption: Incapacitated an enemy using a fire extinguisher.
Lost points from walking into a toilet.

title: Ladder Building

description:
Track & Field II features the following four events.

  • 110 Meter Hurdles
  • Javelin Throw
  • High Jump
  • 1500 Meter Run
title: Track & Field II

description:
Marine Battle is an arcade shooter which pits your destroyer against a multitude of aerial and naval forces. Your ship can move back and forth across the top of the water, and can fire directly upwards at planes or downwards at submarines or the elusive ghost ship whose shadowy presence occasionally manifests itself at the bottom of the screen. Both planes and submarines may fire back at you, and the goal for a given level is to destroy a certain number of submarines before a timer runs out and while avoiding incoming fire.

Destroying a plane will cause its pilot to bail out into the water, and he may be collected for extra points. Your war ship also has a finite amount of ammunition, and a limit on the number of bombs/shots in the air at any one time. When ammo supply runs low, a resupply ship appears at the side of the screen allowing you to restock. Later levels increase the rate of fire of all of the enemies, and the game continues with increasing difficulty until you eventually lose all your lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Bonus points determined for the level.
A ghost ship slinks along the bottom of the screen.

title: Marine Battle

description:
Crazy Bullet is a variant of the arcade game Tank. As in that game, there is a top-down view of an arena containing two equally equipped tanks who engage in a fight to the death. Each tank can fire a bullet at a time, and move to avoid the opponent's fire. Contact with a bullet will destroy your tank, earning your opponent a point, and the first player to five points wins the contest.

The current game has a couple of important differences from the original. The most important is that bullets do not just travel in a straight line after you fire them. They move in the direction in which you last directed your tank. This allows you to fire around corners, and even to shoot yourself (gifting your opponent a free point). Secondly, there are a number of different arenas which can be chosen, with different wall layouts. Some of these layouts also include a turn-style which allows you to pass but stops any pursuing bullets. Finally there are two speed settings (for fast and slow bullets).

sample_screenshots.caption: An arena with lots of walls.
This level has a turn-style in the middle.

title: Crazy Bullet

description: Autoroute is a Frogger variant in French. You lead a team of five frogs that must be brought to their destination by guiding them using the joysticks in the midst of the fury of the speeders and then making them jump on the wooden logs floating on the river. Take care not to hesitate too much on the side of the road as some cars do not hesitate to drive on the low sides.
title: Autoroute

description: Pass Ball is a volleyball-like game. The game is played on a rectangular court with a net in the middle, and a team (each consisting of two players) on either side of the net. Each team's players move in the same direction at the same time, and are separated by a fixed distance so they each control one half of their side of the court. One of the teams starts the rally by serving the ball, and the aim is to hit it into the air so that it lands on the ground on the opponent's side of the net. If you hit the ball out of court, or it falls to the ground on your own side, then the rally is lost. If you are the side serving and you win the rally, then you gain a point. Otherwise, the opponent serves the ball for the next rally. The team that first scores 15 points wins the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Selecting a colour for the court.
The ball seems nearer as it gets higher.

title: Pass Ball

description: North Sea Helicopter is a first-person flight simulator. The player takes control of a helicopter for rescue missions at open sea. It features a detailed control panel, a map to indicate positions, colored graphics, music and digitized voices.
title: North Sea Helicopter

description: Nuts is a 2D side-scrolling beat 'em up for up to two players working together. The gameplay is reminiscent of the original Double Dragon and some of the early Technos Japan titles this game is dedicated to. There are several levels. The character's health bar is shown at the bottom. When an enemy is knocked out, he can be picked up and thrown at opponents. The story tells about two dangerous patients who escape from a mental asylum and are out for revenge.
title: Nuts

description: Scope On is a standard space-based vertical shoot-em-up. Your spacecraft flies across the galaxy, while you are beset by aliens vessels with such names as Sprizer, Lemik and Wonzak. Each vessel type has its own distinctive attack pattern. You can shoot forwards at the aliens, and try to evade them and their shots by moving around anywhere within the lower half of the screen. The only aims are to stay alive for as long as possible, and to amass a high score by taking out as many of the enemy as possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: Later alien ships have different colours.

title: Scope On

description: Break Out is a clone of Breakout. There is a wall of bricks along the top of the screen and your goal is to destroy the entire wall one brick at a time! To do this, you control a paddle at the bottom of the screen which is used to reflect a bouncing ball into the bricks. When the ball hits a brick, it will destroy it. It does not carry an official license. This is the only known game with MSX Paddle support, which were never commercially produced.
title: Break Out

description: Traditional Story is a Japanese-style fantasy RPG for the MSX2. Originally developed by Atsushi Saito in 1987 when he was in junior high school, it was never formally released until 2022. It follows three adventurers on a heroic fantasy journey, incorporating battles using a first-person Dragon Quest-style system.
title: Traditional Story

description:
You have sunk your savings into diving expeditions to find the gold ship the Beau lieu Ann which sank during the mutiny. On meeting an old seaman in a bar, you discover that he was the only survivor of the wreck and that he not only knows its location but also has a scribbled grid which will help to decipher the codes revealing the treasure's location.

The game requires you to negotiate three mazes, but within those mazes you must kill the guardian jellyfish and you can also stun marker fish to help you to orientate yourself as you move.
title: The Wreck

description:
Con-dori is an arcade style game where you control a mother bird defending her eggs from enemies. Your foes arrive from the right of the screen in balloons, and fire missiles at you. By flying into the right spot on the front or rear of the balloon with your beak, you can pop it. If a balloon successfully makes it to the tree with your nest, it will drop a section of ladder. Once three sections of ladder have been dropped, subsequent balloons will drop climbers. These make their way up the ladder and, unless they are knocked off with a precise peck to the back, will take an egg once they pass your nest.

Popping ten balloons on a levels takes you to the next stage. This resets your power, and clears away incomplete sections of ladder. Subsequent levels have faster and more rapidly firing balloons. The game continues until you eventually lose, which can happen in two ways. You can lose all of your lives, either to enemy fire or by running out of power. Or you can lose all of your eggs to the voracious enemy.

sample_screenshots.caption: An enemy is climbing to get my eggs.

title: Con-dori

description:
Hopper is a Frogger variant.

Players have to attempt to get a frog to cross a busy intersection filled with speeding vehicles followed by hopping across a river by jumping onto the backs of swimming turtles and floating logs. Turtles are not the most stable platforms either as they can periodically submerge into the water. While crossing the river, players have to help the frog stay out of the way of otters and snakes. The back of crocodiles can be hopped on but only when their mouth is shut or else the frog can become their light snack.

The objective of each level is to get the frog across five times, once into each bay while doing so with a limited amount of time. On his way to the bay, the frog can earn bonus points by picking up a lady frog and bringing her home to the bay. Also, occasionally one of the bays will hold a fly and the frog can earn additional points by heading into that particular bay. Of course, the frog must avoid a bay when a hungry crocodile can sometimes be found waiting in it.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lot's of traffic on the road
Can you jump? Stay out of the water!

title: Hopper

description:
Moon Landing is a variant of Lunar Lander where you control a rocket that has to land safely at one of five locations on the surface of the moon. The rocket moves under the effect of gravity but may rotate about its axis and activate its thrusters to change its velocity. Using the thrusters consumes fuel, of which you have a limited amount.

A safe landing is achieved if your rocket arrives at the surface within the required area with sufficiently small vertical and horizontal speeds. Hard landings outside of these parameters will result in the loss of a craft, and losing three rockets will end the game.

The landing positions on each screen have different scores, depending on their difficulty. Successful landings at all five locations clears the screen, and then you start again. There are five skill levels available, with the harder levels having increased gravity and a smaller margin on the speed allowed during landing.

sample_screenshots.caption: Landing at all five sites clears the screen.

title: Moon Landing

description:
Checkmate! First Moves in Chess is a program to improve and develop the chess game for beginners. The program consists of five set pieces to challenge the computer:

  • For King and Country - Here you learn to attack the king with the pawns and to defend your own King as well.

  • The King and His Castle - Here you can practice with the Castle.

  • The Knight Charges - Here you will learn everything to use the Knight in the best possible way.

  • The Bishop joins up - Here you will learn all about the Bishop.

  • Enter The Queen - All about the Queen, the second most valuable piece on the board.

The last option "The Full Court" gives you the opportunity to put it all into practice.

The moves are specified in algebraic notations, for example A7 A5. If one has made a good move, the audience will show their appreciation. Moves can also be undone at any time to change and correct mistakes. At the end of the game you can get a complete overview of the moves.

This game was included in the Toshiba HX-10 KIT along with Breakout! The Great Computing Adventure and Teach Yourself BASIC.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Full Court - Now Black makes its move: H2 -> H3
Set 5: Enter The Queen! - All about the Queen, the second most valuable piece on the board.
Title Screen. To start a new game at any time you can press the ESCape key.
The Full Court - Making my first move: A7 -> A5
Set 3: The Knight Charges! - Here you will learn everything to use the Knight in the best possible way.

title: Checkmate! First Moves in Chess

description:
Bee and Flower is a single-screen arcade game. You control a honeybee who, over the course of a day, has to visit flowers at the bottom of the screen and return the nectar to the hive at the top of the screen.

The air between your hive and the ground is patrolled by hostile insects of various sorts: dragonflies, butterflies, ladybirds and wasps. Each of these have distinct movement patterns. For instance, the dragonflies patrol the top part of the screen and move horizontally with frequent pauses. Butterflies on the other hand visit and feed on the flowers near the ground. Once a butterfly has drained a flower of its sustenance, the flower disappears. You can divert the attention of a butterfly by dropping a sugar cube, which it will eat in preference to visiting flowers.

All of the insects can be dispersed using your sting, of which you have an infinite number, and can launch at your opponents in a parabolic arc. Later in the day, a human bug collector that prizes you as a specimen will appear, and is impervious to your sting. Killing an insect gives you points, as does returning to the hive with nectar.

Each level takes place over the course of a day, and ends when you have collected a certain amount of nectar (indicated by the number of grubs lying on the ground). On completing a level, you get a bonus for the amount of time left in the day. And then the next level starts, with more enemies and requiring a larger number of trips to complete.

sample_screenshots.caption: Launching your stinger at a ladybug.
Flying out of reach of the man with the net.

title: Bee & Flower

description:
Nyorols is a single screen action maze game. You start in a maze, which wraps on the sides and the top/bottom, with two different types of opponent. A red opponent that resembles a flame will move vertically and horizontally along the maze passages, and a purple snake, which can also move diagonally and pass through walls. Touching either of these opponents is deadly, but you can attack them in two different ways. By default, you can create invincible clones of yourself which can wander the maze, or lie down as a booby trap. These clones can destroy the enemy on contact, but will do the same to you if you touch them. An alternative attack is available if you touch one of the crosses on the level. This will toggle your colour to red, signifying that you may now kick when facing horizontally.

Taking out an opponent will usually cause it to turn into an impassable barrier, which makes movement around the maze more difficult. Sometimes a heart is produced, which can be collected for bonus points. Later levels resemble the earlier ones, but start with a greater number of enemies.

sample_screenshots.caption: Kicking mode enabled after touching the cross.

title: Nyorols

description:
Police Academy is an arcade game where the player has just passed the exams at the Stick City Police Academy. The player is then assigned to patrol one of the most dangerous neighborhoods. A district known as "Sudden Death Crossings". Here, youth gangs, brutal murderers and other street bandits have united to terrorize the neighborhood.

After choosing whether to use a hand gun or machine gun, the game begins. On the screen the player is constantly shown a street where doors and windows keep opening. Here criminals ("The Bad Ones") or citizens ("The Good Ones") can appear. The mission of the game is to shoot all the different criminals on the screen within a certain time limit. If this is successful, their status will increase. But be careful. The status decreases if the player hits the "Good Ones" or fails to shoot all the criminal "Bad Ones" off the screen within the time limit.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shoot all the different criminals on the screen within a certain time limit. If successful, your status will increase. But be careful. The status decreases if the "Good Ones" get shot or failing to shoot all the "Bad Ones" within the time limit.
Making the choice which Gun Type you want to use. Hand Gun or Machine Gun.
Telling which one are "The Good Ones" and who are "The Bad Ones". Perhaps a references to Jack The Ripper, Pipi Longstocking and the (in)famous Dutchman "Pistolen Paultje"?
On the screen the player is constantly shown a street where doors and windows keep opening. Here criminals ("The Bad Ones") or citizens ("The Good Ones") can appear.

title: Police Academy

description:
Mr. Jaws is a Jawbreaker II clone for the MSX.

The player controls a set of teeth on a Pac-Man-like field that moves horizontally in different layers. The main goal of the game is to eat all the candies and avoid the smiling meatballs. If the player is hit by them, all the teeth in the denture will fall out. However, in the far corners are the Corner Candies. This will briefly change the color of the maze and make it possible for a short time to eat the smiling meatballs and move freely through the field. To get bonus points, the player must grab the candy cane that appears every now and then. Once the screen is clear, the player gets a teeth cleaning and moves on to the next, more difficult level.

It is possible to set the speed at the start of the game by pressing the ESC button. The game can also be paused by pressing STOP and HOME to unpause.

sample_screenshots.caption: You play as a set of teeth on a Pac-Man-like field that moves horizontally in different layers. The main goal of the game is to eat all the candies and avoid the smiling meatballs.
Eating one of the CornerCandies will change the color of the maze and makes it possible to temporarily eat the smiling meatballs and move freely through the field.
However, if the player is hit by them, all the teeth in the denture will fall out.

title: Mr. Jaws

description:
TT Racer is a racing game for the MSX.

The player controls a road racing motorcycle and has to complete the course in twelve laps as fast as possible. After each lap the player gets a full tank to make it to the next one. The race time is displayed at the bottom left. In the middle is the score, the speed, the engine temperature and how much fuel there is left. At higher speeds, the engine temperature increases and the engine uses double the amount of fuel. To avoid this one must reduce the speed. Then the TEMP gradually decreases and FUEL can increase to speed up again. At the bottom right the map of the course is displayed. There the player can see his location, how many laps still have to be done and his position is. An arrow above the road announces the direction of an approaching bend.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start. Controlling a road racing motorcycle and you has to be the first to complete the course in twelve laps. At higher speeds, the engine temperature increases and the engine uses double the amount of fuel.

title: TT Racer

description:
Indy 500 is a racing game for the MSX.

The player controls a racing car and has to complete the course in twelve laps as fast as possible. At the top of the screen the lap time is displayed, high score, the actual score, the speed, how many laps the player has left and what position he is in. Pay attention to the tyre and fuel consumption. The tires will wear out when the red and white sides of the track are touched. If TYRE or FUEL reaches 0, the player will not be able to drive at high speed. To refuel or change tires, go to the Pit Stop. This is indicated with the "P" above the road. To change tires move the blue cross on the screen to one of the men who are standing near the tires. Then press the fire button or the space bar. The refuelling occurs automatically, though. An arrow above the road announces the direction of an approaching bend.

sample_screenshots.caption: You control a racing car and has to complete the course in twelve laps as fast as possible. Pay attention to the TYRES and FUEL consumption. The wheels will wear out when you touch the red and white sides of the track.
An arrow above the road announces the direction of an approaching bend or the possibility to can go to the Pit. This is marked by a "P" on the track.
To change tires move the blue cross on the screen to one of the men who are standing near the tires. Then press the fire button or the space bar. The refueling occurs automatically, though.

title: Indy 500

description:
Hard Boiled is a maze action game in which the player takes control of a dinosaur beast in an egg on caterpillar tread called Edward Egg the Third.

The object of the game is to reach the end of the long corridor in sector delta. Each sector, alpha, beta, gamma and delta consists of 50 rooms that have a number of connecting doors. To open these doors, the player must look for the keys scattered throughout the maze. Each key has a different symbol on it. This means that the doors can only be opened with a key with the same symbol. To reach the new sector via the planet's surface one must use the key card that can be found in each sector. Enemies also roam each sector, but these can be shot or avoided.

There are also objects that can give an extra life, such as an egg, question mark (or refuel) and one green die. However, the green die can add or take away a life. To refuel, the player must find objects such as a fuel tank, cold beer, banana, apple, grapes or a pear. This can also be found in combinations such as the puzzle pieces FU and EL, etc. Only two items can be carried at a time; As soon as a third is picked up, the player loses one of the two items already in his possession. To get information about the object, press the O key. To use object 1, press number 1 and press 2 for object 2.

sample_screenshots.caption: Behind the Alpha Door lies another key. It allows you to open another one.
Oops....this will happen when you lose a life.
To refuel, the player must find objects such as a pear. Other objects are; fuel tank, cold beer, banana, apple and grapes.
Found the Lowhit Bullets Power-up. This one allows you to shoot low.

title: Hard Boiled

description:
Alpine Ski is a ski sports game for the MSX.

The player controls a skier and must complete the ski-run as quickly as possible. To do this, the player must pass the red and blue flags in the right direction to earn seconds. If the flag points to the right, it should be passed on the right side. And vice versa if it points to the left. Seconds can also be lost if a red flag is passed on the wrong side. Then there will be a penalty of 15 seconds, and a penalty of 10 seconds when passing the blue flag on the wrong side. The player can fall if a speed limit of 250 km/h is exceeded.

There are four different events available in the selection menu;

  • Reuze Slalom (Giant slalom) - The poles are far apart.

  • Slalom - The poles are close together.

  • Combination - A little bit of both.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting the Reuze Slalom. In this event the poles are far apart. You must pass the red and blue flags in the right direction to earn seconds. If the flag points to the right, it should be passed on the right side. And vice versa if it points to the left.
Reuze Slalom - Approaching a blue flag. It points to the right, right? Now what to do? There will be a penalty of 10 seconds when passing the blue flag on the wrong side.
Reuze Slalom - Crashed!!! The player can fall if a speed limit of 250 km/h is exceeded or (crash into one of the poles, like I did)

title: Alpine Ski

description: Roboy is an arcade shoot-'em-up in which the players takes control of a robot in an elevator that can move up and down. The object of the game is to destroy all the blocks that fall from the ceiling before they manage to cover the holes in the floor and thus create a path for the dragon to walk up to Roboy and smash him. The blocks have different speeds and durability. Some will need a single shot, others several. Others will accelerate their fall when they are hit. The game supports one or two players. If it is played by two players each player takes it in turn when the other player loses a life.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start. Destroy all the blocks falling from the ceiling before they manage to cover the holes in the floor and thus create a path for the dragon to walk up to Roboy and smash him.

title: Roboy

description:
Speedboat Racer is a speedboat racing game for the MSX.

The player controls a speedboat and has to complete the course outlined by 2 buoys on a lake, in twelve laps as fast as possible. The screen displays at the bottom left the record time, the race time and water. The latter displays the wash of the waves. Extreme care must be taken in controlling wave action as the boat may capsize in very rough seas. In the middle is the speed and how much fuel there is left. It is important to keep an eye on the wind indicator that is specified by an arrow. This is where the player sees the strength and direction of the wind. At higher speeds, there is the risk of flying up in the air. The bottom right of the screen shows the player's position, how many rounds must be completed and how many laps still to go.

sample_screenshots.caption: At higher speeds, there is the risk of flying up in the air.....and that just happened.
Phew. I finished the first round.
Ooops. I capsized because of the rough water.

Start of the race. WATER displays the wash of the waves. Extreme care must be taken in controlling wave action as the boat may capsize in very rough seas. The "WIND" indicator (specified by an arrow) indicates the strength and direction of the wind.

title: Speedboat Racer

description:
Bounce is a variant of the well-known Breakout where the player has to bounce away all the blocks on the screen as quickly as possible. There are some subtle differences from the original game. One of them is that the movement form is not based on controlling the ball using a bat, but on the bouncing effect of the ball Bouncer against the walls that bounce the blocks away. The other difference is that the player(s) can influence the direction of the ball. If the joystick/cursor keys are moved in the same direction as the ball while the Bouncer bounces, it will accelerate. Steering in the opposite direction slows down Bouncer.

The playing field is filled with blocks. These are different in color with different properties:

  • Red - These blocks do not disappear.

  • Yellow - These blocks only need to be hit once.

  • Green - These blocks must be hit six times.

  • Purple - Now the ball can move in any direction, and even be stopped.

  • Blue - May contain the monsters that is chosen from the ones that are abled. There are eight different monsters. Some will give penalty seconds, an extra Bouncer, or destroy it.

The playing field also contains colored lines:

  • Red - Bouncer bounces.

  • Green - If the ball goes down it will bounce, otherwise it will go right through the line.

  • Blue - Bouncer comes to a stop.

A two-player mode has been implemented, where each player can take a turn if the other player has lost a life. It also comes with a level editor that allows the player to customize or create their own levels. It is then possible to save them to a disk/tape under one of the Bou.Level names. Then choose a name and press the fire button or space bar to confirm.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the Menu Screen it is possible to start a game (F1) but the player(s) can also adjust or create their own levels by pressing (F2). It is then possible to save them to a disk/tape under one of the Bou.Level names with F3. Then choose a name.
Here you can adjust or create your own levels.
One of the options is to change the monsters. A YES or NO box will appear. You can change them with the fire button or the space bar. Use the joystick/cursor keys to move from monster to monster.

title: Bounce

description: Time Bomb is an Inca I clone in which the player needs to defuse each of the bombs that can be found on each screen in a limited time. (50 seconds per bomb) By jumping from stone to stone or by climbing or changing ropes they can be reached. The player needs to avoid skeletons, birds, lava, projectiles, barbed wires and other dangers that inhabit the jungle. There are also moving platforms that can cushion the player's falls or make it possible to reach some area that cannot be reached by jumping. The game supports one or two players. If it is played by two players each player takes it in turn when the other player loses a life. Each player starts with five lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start. The player needs to defuse each of the bombs that can be found on each screen in a limited time. (50 seconds per bomb) Watch out for the skeletons and birds.

title: Time Bomb

description:
Leather Skirts is an adult top-down maze game in which the player navigates through a labyrinth to find the woman of his dreams, Princess Scheherasade. Along the way, the player must collect leather skirts scattered throughout the labyrinth. The number of skirts to collect depends on the level reached. Energy continually decreases but the player can regain it by eating and drinking in the pub or local inn. A visit to the prostitutes in the Red Light District, symbolized by a bed, reduces energy but provides an extra life.

The labyrinth renews itself every time a new game is started. On the screen it can be seen in close-up on the left and in its entirety on the right.

sample_screenshots.caption: Found the symbol of a plate.
The other way to regain energy is eating at the local inn.
Found the symbol of a glass of beer.
A visit to the prostitutes in the Red Light District, reduces energy but provides an extra life.

title: Leather Skirts

description:
Chopper is a Zaxxon clone in which the player must free his comrades who are trapped behind enemy lines. In order to fulfill this objective, the player must fly his chopper over various crowded cities, treacherous deserts and powerful military installations deep in enemy territory while destroying guided missiles and AstroJets. If the comrades, who are waiting for help deep in enemy territory, are found they must be picked up and brought back safely to one of the bases.

As soon as one of the comrades comes into view, an attempt can be made to land the chopper on a small landing site. The comrade will then automatically climb into the helicopter. The player has limited fuel. This can be refueled by landing at one of the bases.

sample_screenshots.caption: Free your comrades who are trapped behind enemy lines. This is by flying with your chopper over various crowded cities, treacherous deserts and powerful military installations deep in enemy territory while destroying guided missiles and AstroJets.

title: Chopper

description:
Red Lights of Amsterdam is an adult poker game in which the player plays against a charming young woman. Each time the player wins, the female opponent will exchange her clothes for more points to continue playing.

The cards are projected on the left half, as well as the status of the game and information about the score and bet. The right side of the screen covers each digitized images. The player and its opponent start with the starting capital of 100 points. The fixed bet (Ante) is 5 points. Then each person is dealt five cards. If the player has a good card, he can bid up to a maximum of 25. The player can also choose to take it easy with "stay" or "drop" if the card offers no perspective. If a counter-offer has been raised, the player can indicate whether or not to go along. There is then the option to exchange the cards. Then the procedure can be repeated. If the 100 points are taken, the opponent automatically gets it back (another garment). However, if she loses the round, she drops an article of clothing.

sample_screenshots.caption: The cards are projected on the left half, as well as the status of the game and information about the score and bet. The right side of the screen covers each digitized images. The player and its opponent start with the starting capital of 100 points.

title: Red Lights of Amsterdam

description:
The boiling point of a revolution is reached and violence erupts in the deserts and plains of the United Republic of Abadeer. Now Hasan the Merciless, leader of the Abadeer Liberation Front, begins a campaign of terror against the multinational Oxxan Oil Company. Because Lawrence, the President of the United Republic of Abadeer, refuses to act and stop the slaughter, Grey Mantis, a deadly Jet Bomber, is hired by Oxxan Oil Company.

Jet Bomber is an arcade simulation in which the player must fly secretly into Abadeer, past army and rebels to destroy the rebel base. The aim of the game is to have the player progress from one phase to another while shooting and bombing as many targets as possible. The more hits, the more fuel and points are earned. Missiles that can hit the player must also be avoided.

The game is split into 5 phases;

  • Phase 1: Army and Rebels - Fly low to target the barracks on the ground and the fuel tanks. Missiles that can hit the player must also be avoided.

  • Phase 2: First Bombardment - This time fly as high as possible to avoid detection by enemy radar and bomb the target on the ground. Avoid the approaching missiles again.

  • Phase 3: Fighters - A fleet of fighters must be driven away by flying at the same altitude as the enemy.

  • Phase 4: Second Bombardment - Same as Phase 2, but now the missiles move at an incredible speed.

  • Phase 5: Rebel base - Destroy the rebel base by flying at the right altitude while avoiding the deadly fire.

In Phases 1 - 4 there are also activated enemy anti-aircraft guns on all sides.

sample_screenshots.caption: Phase 1: Army and Rebels - Fly low to target the barracks on the ground and the fuel tanks. Missiles that can hit the player must also be avoided.
Phase 1: Army and Rebels - Aahh. I am hit!!! Watch out for the activated enemy anti-aircraft guns that are on all sides.

title: Jet Bomber

description:
Star Wars is a Missile Command variant in which the player, a Cadet of the Kenobian Air Defense, must intercept the laser pulses that the hostile Darth Ung fires at the Kenioban metropoles.

At the bottom are the defense stations represented by three triangles with the six metropoles in between. Enemy laser beams come down from space from various directions. To defend the metropoles, the player must aim his lasers at them using the crosshairs. Later the enemy lasers come down faster and faster, as well as enemy ships that directly attack the defense stations and spaceships that fire whole series at the same time. The number of shots the player has per level is limited.

sample_screenshots.caption: IF option a or b is selected, an anti-Pulse missile will be launched from the site closest to the chosen target. When using the cursor key controls, you can also press "Q", "W" or "E" each dedicated to one of the three missile bases to fire.
You, a Cadet of the Kenobian Air Defense, must intercept the laser pulses that the hostile Darth Ung fires at the Kenioban metropoles. To fire use either fire button or space bar.

title: Star Wars

description: The Martians are invading Earth and innocent civilians are being annihilated. Your job is to defend our human population and fend off the onslaught. Martian War is a remake of a Wang 2200 game by the same title. Players move their fighter ship left and right just off the ground, above a number of pedestrians and shoot aliens flying above, killing people. There is a finite number of enemy ships and a finite number of humans, but players have an infinite number of lives. However, each time you sustain a hit, you suffer a time penalty where aliens roam about unopposed. If all people are annihilated you lose, but if you shoot down all aliens before that happens, you win. The game runs on text-only 80 column mode and uses only text characters and symbols.

sample_screenshots.caption: Two aliens left, but they got us first.
The game keeps track of how many enemies and how many civilians are currently left.
The game has just begun and we already have one human casualty.
Now there's just three people left.

title: Martian War

description:
Chopper II is an action simulation game in which the player is given command of a fully armored attack helicopter that is still in service after a battle between two rulers fighting for a piece of jungle terrain. The aim of the game is to rescue injured survivors from the Colombian jungle and return them to base. Enemy planes and helicopters must be shaken off and artillery on the ground avoided or destroyed.

The upper part of the screen consists of a computerized three-dimensional image and represents the space and the objects traveling through it. The shape of an object is an indication of its condition, such as a circle for a flying object, a triangle for a ground vehicle. The lower part shows the instrument panel. The on-board computer communicates messages from headquarters to the player. It tells you whether refueling, arming or picking up wounded people is necessary. The instrument panel displays all movements (turn, altitude and fore-aft), as well as a speedometer, turbine temperature indicator, two fuel gauges, radar and compass. An identification system tells whether it is an enemy or friendly object. Finally, two options indicate the status of the helicopter and its weapons stock. It is also possible to switch and lock weapons.
title: Chopper II

description:
The Apeman Strikes Again is a Donkey Kong clone in which the player must free his damsel in distress from Kang, the Monkey King of Kong and achieve a high score. There are four levels in this game. In the first screen Kang rolls barrels towards the player who can smash them with a hammer to gain bonus points. Once the barrels have hit the oil barrel, then "living" fireballs must also be avoided.

The second screen is set in a pie factory and the player must move on conveyor belts and climb ladders to get to Kang. Also the "living" fireballs and pies must be avoided. The third screen is an elevator-themed level where the enemies exist of "living" fireballs and spring-weights. The last level is where the player needs to remove rivets from girders of a building to make Kang fall down. At the same time, the player must also avoid the "living" fireballs.

Each level starts with a set number of bonus points which counts down over time so the faster the screen is completed the more points are gained. If all bonus points are gone, the player loses a life. Umbrellas and other items can also be collected for bonus points.

sample_screenshots.caption: The second screen is set in a pie factory and the player must move on conveyor belts and climb ladders to get to Kang. Also the "living" fireballs and pies must be avoided.
Start of the game. In the first screen Kang rolls barrels towards the player. Once the barrels have hit the oil barrel, then "living" fireballs must also be avoided.
Can you beat us? Yes we can....I hope.
It is possible to jump over the barrels, but you can also smash them with a hammer to gain bonus points.

title: The Apeman Strikes Again

description:
Miner Machine is a Boulder Dash variant in which the player must collect all the square lumps of gold, that have been trapped by an earthquake. This must be done before the time, shown in the upper right corner of the screen, runs out. Running out of time results in an instant Game Over. The miner machine can push stones in different directions, dig its way through the layers of sand, collect the gold bars and avoid or destroy enemies by slinging the vacant rocks at them. Being hit by a bat costs the player a life. A red rock can be moved aside pressing the firing button/space bar while moving in the direction the player wants it moved. However, this can only be done if there is no obstacle in it path. Although the bats are unable to penetrate the blue areas of the screen (mine dust), the player can. However, if the player has cleared a way through the mine dust, the bats can then move through the pathways that have been made.

The game features two difficulty levels, each of which contains 25 fields to clear. It also includes a game editor where players can build, save, and play their own levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oops. Came in contact with a bat and lost a life.
Running out of time results in an instant Game Over.
It will ask for the number of the dungeon, with 1 and 2 to choose from, with 0 to launch a room editor.

You must collect all the square lumps of gold, that have been trapped by an earthquake. This must be done before the time, shown in the upper right corner of the screen, runs out. Running out of time results in an instant Game Over.

title: Miner Machine

description:
During the first trip the "Neptunix", the cargo ship of which the player is the captain, is in good condition except for a few holes in the hull.

Sailor's Delight is a simulation game in which the player controls the robot C-Bot 9000 to prevent an old cargo ship "Neptunix" getting flooded. At the top of the screen there are several indicators that should be closely monitored. The total score and the salary per trip are shown at the top left. The latter can be used to pay for repairs when the player finish the trip and the remainder of the salary is added to the total score.

Next to it there is a graph that shows the ship with its seven compartments, three in the hold and four on deck. Once a flooded compartment has been located, the cracks in the floor must be covered with a number of plates found in different parts of the ship. After the player has repaired a leak, it is necessary to pump out all the water that has entered the hold from the ship. These pumps are not in good condition and the robot will also have to repair them.

To the right there is "Robot Power". All the time it will slowly run out. If it runs out, the player will lose a life. To charge the "Robot Power", the robot needs to be taken to the power plant. Below the "Robot Power" is the course meter, where one can see if the ship is changing course and needs to be corrected, a thermometer where the player can see if the temperature of the engines increases or decreases significantly, the Time and an object window. To select objects, the player must stand next to them and press "Select". Finally, there is the water level. That indicates how high the water is.

sample_screenshots.caption: Getting charged at the power plant.
Using the Plate (With SELECT) to cover this hole in the hold.
Oh no! This hold is full of water.

title: Sailor's Delight

description:
Star Command is a variant of the mainframe game Star Trek. You control the starship Enterprise. Your continuing mission: to seek out and destroy attacking Klimzon vessels before a time-limit runs out.

The main screen shows two views of this part of the galaxy. The top view is the long range scan, which shows a grid of quadrants. Explored areas and anything within range of the long range scanners are represented by three numbers: the number of klimzons, the number of your bases, and the number of stars. Unexplored regions are represented by hashes. The bottom view is the short range scan, and shows the sectors within the current quadrant. Asterisks are stars, the Enterprise is an E, Klimzons are K and bases are B.

There are numerous options for controlling your starship. Movement is accomplished by selecting either Warp Drive for long range travel, or Impulse Drive for movement within the quadrant. The course is selected as the angle clockwise from galactic North in degrees, followed by the distance to travel. Landing on top of a base will re-supply your energy, shield and torpedoes, after which the base disappears.

Landing in a quadrant containing Klimzons will take you to the battle screen. Here, you can select a weapon to fire. Torpedoes require you to specify an angle of fire, and will only cause damage if it collides with a ship. It may take up to three direct hits to take down a fully capable Klimzon war vessel. Phasers can be used to attack multiple vessels. The amount of damage done by phasers depends on the amount of power used, which may be varied. More powerful phaser attacks will deplete your energy faster. You may also move, again by specifying a heading and then moving forwards in that direction. This may allow you to dodge your opponent's torpedoes.

The game ends when either time runs out, or your ship is destroyed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Klimzons surround one of your bases.

title: Star Command

description: Ice is an arcade game in which the player controls a penguin trying to get through each stage. Each screen is partly filled with a pattern of ice-cubes. In among the ice-cubes are diamonds which increase in number as the game progresses. The object of the game is to move all the diamonds across the field so that they are next to each other. By kicking an ice-cube or a diamond, the player can move it. If any of the sunglasses-wearing monsters are on the other side, they will be incapacitated, at least temporarily. But if there is a diamond or ice cube on the other side, the ice cube will shatter and create a walking space.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now the diamonds are together you'll go to the next level and will hear a digitized speech saying "Next Level".
Start location. The object of the game is to move all the diamonds across the field so that they are next to each other.

title: Ice

description:
Star Fighter is an arcade game in which the player travels outside the galaxy for the first time. He is selected to be part of the Military Exchange Program with the Jedh-Nen allies. They can help combat the large number of enemy space stations that are increasingly closing in on supply locations.
