After taking off with the Cruise Shuttle accompanied by two crew members, the following indications will be on the screen: At the top of the screen is the area where the player can observe its journey in space, as well as the enemies that try to hinder the mission. On the right is the Fuel and Shield and at the bottom of the screen is the Galactic chart.

Move the cursor to the desired position and press fire to engage warp. To warp to the correct quadrant in space hold the vibrating sight above the static computer navigator. The colored diamond-shaped figure indicates a refueling depot. Squares indicate enemy space stations.

If the chosen location is other than an enemy space station, the player will be confronted with meteorites. Shoot them with the fire button or space bar and aim the laser with the cursor keys or joystick. If a meteorite hits the ship the defense shield is weakened. Should the shield be nullified completely and any new impact is sustained, the ship will be destroyed, terminating the mission.

If an enemy space station is chosen, the player must first destroy the suicidal Urnuth space fighters in the same way as the meteorites before arriving there. Then encrypted sequence of digits must be deciphered to crack the code.

Once the code is cracked the player must traverse the Grid. However the entrance to the power core is booby-trapped. A safe passage requires the use of a small supply of "dummies" stored in a corner of the hall. If the square is red, it is safe; otherwise it is a booby trap. After taking a safe route through the Grid, the player must now destroy the enemy’s Main power reactor and then escape from the collapsing station cavern.

sample_screenshots.caption: If a meteorite hits the ship the defense shield is weakened. Should the shield be nullified completely and any new impact is sustained, the ship will be destroyed, terminating the mission.

title: Star Fighter

description:
Drome is an arcade game for the MSX in which the player must destroy Drome's defense system forever. This can be done by entering one of the 4 quadrants from the Central Control Room;

  • The wire - This is the part of the Drome's main wiring circuit. Here the task is to destroy the big orange protons coming towards the player.

  • The BikeLiters - Escape from the enemy, or kill him by forcing him to collide with the colored trail the Bikes leave behind.

  • The Tanks - The player must destroy its opponents tank.

  • The Valve - Now the player must blast a hole in the Valve until it is big enough to escape through. Beware of the multiple lasers that send a fire curtain across the floor.

If the energy bar at the bottom of the screen is empty before a mission is complete, the player will lose a life.

sample_screenshots.caption: The BikeLiters - Escape from the enemy, or kill him by forcing him to collide with the colored trail the Bikes leave behind.
Central Control Room. Destroy Drome's defense system forever by entering one of the 4 quadrants.

title: Drome

description:
Sky Vision is a vertical scrolling shoot 'em up game for the MSX.

The player controls a space ship along the bottom of the screen and has to destroy the various hordes of enemies that will attack the player in waves. The enemies fly in formations and will either try to shoot missiles or collide with the player's ship. In the later stages they will attack from behind as well.

sample_screenshots.caption: Reward points for each one of them.
Wave 2. This time they need to be shot twice to destroy them.

title: Sky Vision

description:
Aqua Polis SOS is a fixed screen arcade game similar to Lunar Rescue . The undersea city is under attack, and its citizens need to be rescued. You control a submersible that is deployed from a ship, and must descend to the city of Aquapolis, rescue someone, and return to the ship.

On your descent to the city, you must dodge sea-creatures including several forms of randomly floating jellyfish, whose stinging tentacles will cause the loss of a submersible. There is also a giant sea-horse which will hold your vessel motionless for a few seconds once it is captured. You can activate some jets to slow your descent to help avoid these obstacles, but this uses fuel. At the bottom of the screen, you must then land on one of the buildings and wait for a refugee to board.

After collecting a refugee, you must return to your ship at the surface. On the ascent, you can fire missiles to clear the path of obstacles. Returning to the surface without the ship nearby will cause you to lose a life, perhaps due to hyperbaric decompression. During both ascent and descent, the city is beset by missiles. You can control the opening and closing of a laser defence barrier to defend the buildings, but the shield needs to be open to allow your submersible to enter. Any missile able to bypass the shield may take out one of the city buildings.

Each level of the game requires you to rescue five people from the city. Subsequent levels are made more difficult by increasing the number of jellyfish. Any buildings that are destroyed in earlier levels are not regenerated. The game ends when you run out of submersibles or all of the city buildings are destroyed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Activating the barrier against a missile.

title: Aqua Polis SOS

description:
30 MSX Hits is a compilation of 30 programs for MSX (and MSX 2). This compilation contains:

  • Star Fighter
  • Speedboat Racer
  • Oh Shit!
  • The Heist
  • Spy Story
  • Beach Head
  • MuSiX - This music utility for 16K + MSX Machines works on the basis of the street organ. It also allows to edit, save and playback your own created music later.
  • Skooter
  • Mazes Unlimited
  • Hard Boiled
  • Break In
  • Master Voice - This is a program that can record sounds via a microphone and then use them later in your own programs.
  • Chopper I
  • Pico Pico
  • Sorcery
  • The Traingame
  • Boulderdash 1
  • Life in the Fast Lane
  • Robot Wars
  • Police Academy 1
  • Miner Machine
  • Spy versus Spy
  • Jet Bomber
  • Boulderdash 2
  • Polar Star
  • Happy Fret
  • Sky Vision
  • Boardello
  • Oil's Well
  • Confused?
title: 30 MSX Hits

description:
Science Fiction is a shoot-'em-up game in which the player is a talented Space Researcher, who preferred the challenge to make big money in the war industry. Imagine having descended on an unknown and deserted Astro-body, somewhere in the outskirts of the Galaxy. Not that deserted though, for there is this Demented Dragon, an old rake, that has an appetite for anyone who just happens to pass by.

The player controls a WingCraft and must defeat the Demented Dragon by destroying the malignant red intellect lobe that frequently appears in the core of the Dragon's brain. This is not without danger. While trying to penetrate the Dragon's head, the player must dodge the RocketTeeth that the monster drops when hit by the TadpolJectiles. Frequently, the Demented Dragon will drop down a tear which turn into marauding Demon when getting too close. Hitting other objects in the ToothBar (the colored bar in which the RocketTeeth are implanted) could result in temporary malfunctions, such as loss of power or mobility. The exploding Skulls & Crossbones kill the player.

sample_screenshots.caption: ....which turn into marauding Demon when getting too close.
Frequently, the Demented Dragon will drop down a tear....

The start of the game with digitized speech: "Get Ready!". Control a WingCraft and defeat the Demented Dragon by destroying the malignant red intellect lobe that frequently appears in the core of the Dragon's brain.

title: Science Fiction

description:
Space Rescue is an arcade game for the MSX.

Special extra-terrestrial space rescue team, Gullom for short, is on alert. Countless commrades are stranded on a dying planet. The aim of the game is to descend from the Gullom flag ship, to the lunar surface to rescue them. Down below are nine landing stations each worth between 50 and 150 points. Upon landing on them (which are destroyed on takeoff), the ship picks up a man and has to be taken back to the mother ship. Avoid the meteorites and spaceships, which are blocking the mother ship and trying to destroy the player's ship. Once all the nine men from each landing stations have been retrieved the player can then go to the next level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Yikes. It is an utterly precise operation to get back into the mother ship. Otherwise..... (Bytebusters, Eaglesoft release)

title: Space Rescue

description:
Exterminator is a shoot-'em-up in which the player takes the role of Exterminator, because he is the best he has been put in the hottest place in the Universe, at the border of civilization.

The screen consists of a field filled with blocks and the player can maneuver his plane between them. The enemy also flies here in all directions trying to shoot the player down. The aim of the game is to eliminate the enemy. This can be done by pressing the fire button/space bar and then indicating the direction in which to fire. When the fire button/spacebar is released, the player will fly in the indicated direction. All this can be done in four directions; left, right, up and down. When the ammunition runs out, it can be refilled at the Cross.

sample_screenshots.caption: The screen consists of a field filled with blocks and the player can maneuver his plane between them. The enemy also flies here in all directions trying to shoot the player down.
Each time an enemy is shot it will go through a series of metamorphoses.

title: Exterminator

description:
Snake is a variation of the Snake type of games. The player controls a snake moving about the screen. At the start the snake is very short but grows quickly once it eats the blue (10 points plus one) and purple (20 points plus one) balls until the entire screen is clear. The black and white dots also occasionally appear, which will give between 10 to 100 bonus points. Some green blocks will also appear that should be avoided. Hitting them causes the loss of a life and the level starts from the beginning. Using the fire button or space bar, the player can "shoot" to destroy these blocks. (the snake sticks out its tongue). However, each time it is used it will subtract 10 points. The snake starts to accelerate when the cursor or joystick is pressed up and by pressing the cursor or joystick left and right it will move sideways.

There is an option to choose the level at which to start (15 in total) and the speed.

sample_screenshots.caption: It is level 2 and it is getting harder. Look at those green squares.
Using the fire button or space bar, the player can "shoot" to destroy these blocks. (the snake sticks out its tongue). However, each time it is used it will subtract 10 points.
Each time you've finish a level you MAY get a time bonus. Well....not me.
The black and white dots also occasionally appear, which will give between 10 to 100 bonus points.
Explanation and here you choose the level at which to start (15 in total) and the speed.

title: Snake

description:
747 Flight Simulator is a flight simulator that is instrumental in teaching interpretation of the readings of many panels and the knowledge of the aircraft the player is flying. The runway stretches for miles in front of the cockpit when the signal to take off comes from the tower.

After loading/booting up the game the auto-pilot option screen will appear, enabling the player to set the parameters of the simulator. The key elements of the simulator are: Thrust control, Pitch control, Gear up/down control and Flap controls. These can be switched on (autopilot on) or off (autopilot off). Now the player can hover the cursor over the selected key and press the fire button. When Continue is touched, the screen shows a Boeing 747 from a side position and the sound of the four Pratt and Whitney engines can be heard until full power is reached.

A flight instrument panel is also shown. The main instruments are: the vertical speed indicator, showing your rate of climb or descend in 1000 feets per minute; the altitude indicator, showing the distance to the ground in 1000 feet steps, 1 full circle dial sweep = 1000 ft; and the airspeed indicator, showing the airspeed in knots. Next to these instruments, a cathode ray tube display (crt) shows relevant flight information and the flight control computers comment as they occur. Following this display's orders will let the player fly the plane "on instruments", in Full Control and at the highest difficulty levels. It is possible to choose autopilot at any time during the game.

When the Jumbo Jet has touched down and rollout, there is also the option to print-out the flight logbook, up to the moment of aborting or switching off the engine.
title: 747 Flight Simulator

description:
Haunted House is an action game in which the player takes the role of Joe Kowalski who must find his way through 16 rooms to get out of his nightmare. This is made difficult for him by floating eyeballs, Frankie, Dracula, fire, blood dripping from paintings, spirits, goblins and even the terrifying Brainiac. To get out of each room he has to find the clue to the hidden passages and secret stairs and use the keys to open the doors.

To destroy each enemy, Joe can crush them with a falling block or by throwing a silver ball. By pressing F1 he can throw the silver ball. Special items can also be used to defeat enemies such as a candle against bats, blood flowers and dripping fire or a rosary against the coffin, etc. To collect items, Joe has to walk over them. The player can see at the bottom right of the screen which items are in his possession. There are also switches that can be used by jumping up to reach them.

At the bottom of the screen, near the score, the upper part of a skeleton can be seen containing a red and quietly beating heart. If Joe has multiple contacts with some monsters, the heart changes color and starts to beat faster. Too much contact with them will lead to a heart attack. And one life will be lost. The player has four lives throughout the game and 100 seconds per room.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting location. To get out of each room Joe Kowalski has to find the clue to the hidden passages and secret stairs and use the keys to open the doors. Beware of the monsters that will try to stop him.

title: Haunted House

description: The game is pretty much a remake of Mazes Unlimited with the same gameplay mechanics and interface, but with upscale layouts and sprites, which makes the level scroll instead of being shown on a single screen.
title: Maze Master

description:
Vortex Raider is a Warroid clone set against the beautiful yet disturbing scenery of outer Lombardije, a space suburb not far from Gnarf, the restaurant at the end of the Universe.

As Vortex Raider, the player has to search and destroy the enemies of the SYSTEM. This is done by defeating every opponent with a close range space-Kalishnikov hairline action laserbolted riotgun while trying to get some protection from their bullets. To do this, platforms placed all over the screen serve as both support and shield.

Both the player and his opponent have energy levels as seen in the upper right of the screen. Each successful shot from the opponent causes the player to lose energy, with zero energy resulting in one life less. Each time an opponent is eliminated, the player moves on to a successive level with a new enemy base (space or land) as a setting. As the player progresses through levels, things become more and more complicated. The enemy will become faster and, in addition, sometimes he will throw some kind of "mines" at the player that will take away a lot of health.

The balloons give speed or bonus points, the red ones subtract energy and the "pills" slows down the shot. This will effect both the player and its opponents.

sample_screenshots.caption: Loading Screen. Another game featuring Joe Kowalski.

Defeat every opponent with a close range space-Kalishnikov hairline action laserbolted riotgun while trying to get some protection from their bullets by using the platforms placed all over the screen as both support and shield.

title: Vortex Raider

description:
Meaning of Life is an arcade adventure game in which the player is assigned to assemble the brand new Soviet nuclear device KRAZY. This is done by tracking down all the missile components scattered in the factory and bringing them to the assembly spot one by one. A DEMO mode shows where the assembly spot is located. At the top right of the screen is a clock counting down from 5000 to 0. As soon as 0 is reached, the player loses a life. The player can encounter many dangers that cause the loss of a life as well, such as hitting platforms, stepping on landmines, getting shot by machine guns, etc.

It has three difficulty levels and ESC aborts the game and returns to DEMO mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: First you will hear digitised speech saying: "Hit any key". Press now the fire button/Spacebar and.....
...and then only to drop down in Hell!!!

...you'll now hear digitized speech saying: "Will start". Track down all the missile components of the brand new Soviet nuclear device KRAZY scattered in the factory and bring them to the assembly spot one by one. There's a time limit and many dangers.

title: Meaning of Life

description: Guttblaster is a vertical shoot-'em-up in which the player controls a spaceship that needs to destroy all enemies on the screen to move on to a new level. Enemies can approach from all sides and some can only be destroyed by a certain type of ammunition. The ammo type can be changed by passing the ship over the circled numbers. The ammo consist of: (1) single bullets, (2) triple bullets, (3) round bombs that move in a circle around the spaceship and (4) bombs fired simultaneously in an up-and downward direction. It is not possible to choose from the ammo types, the last captured ammo remains in use until a new circled number has been picked.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start of Level 1, round 1. Destroy all enemies on the screen that can approach from all sides. Some can only be destroyed by a certain type of ammunition. The ammo type can be changed by passing the ship over the circled numbers.
Just like any Mastergames series, Joe Kowalski is featured in the loading screen.

title: Guttblaster

description:
The excavation went very well. Underneath the titanic pyramid the team had located an entry point to an underground complex. According to legend, the burial chamber of Shartek, an ancient tyrant of Egypt. He had ruled for 150 years, keeping all his subjects under his reign of terror using his weapons of Death and his black magic. The legend also spoke of the curse he cast with his last breath to protect his corpse and his immense riches from grave robbers. In these times of information, of course, no one believes a word of this...But just in case, the team had brought in the daredevil Joe Kowalski.

Pharaoh's Revenge is an action game in which the player takes the role of Joe Kowalski who must survey the area and locate the treasure chamber. However, the maze is guarded by traps and its deadly tomb guardians. The latter chase Joe around the maze, and are armed with swords, bows and spears. There are also a few items that can help him to survive, such as pistol ammo, keys, and potion bottles that will immunize Joe against the usually deadly tomb guardians.

Fire/space bar fires his gun when it is loaded and pressing the F1 key causes Joe to commit suicide.

sample_screenshots.caption: However, the maze is guarded by deadly traps and its deadly tomb guardians. The latter chase Joe around the maze, and are armed with swords, bows and spears.
Get ready for Round one and Room one.
Starting location. You take the role of Joe Kowalski who must survey the area and locate the treasure chamber.

title: Pharaoh's Revenge

description:
Pinball Blaster is a pinball game in which, unlike other games, the flippers have been replaced by a cannon that can fire a continuous load of bullets. With these bullets, the ball must be guided in the correct paths to collect points by hitting letters, blocks, stars, etc. Not only will this give extra points but it will also trigger off different objects so that the screen layout is continually changing. It is possible to have two balls at the same time.

It supports 1-4 players and is controlled by the cursors or joystick.

sample_screenshots.caption: How many players? It supports 1-4 players.

Starting the game. The flippers have been replaced by a cannon that can fire a continuous load of bullets. With these bullets, the ball must be guided in the correct paths to collect points by hitting letters, blocks, stars, etc.

title: Pinball Blaster

description:
Jet Fighter is an arcade action game combined with flight simulation in which the player pilots a Crusader Jet. He also controls a surface-to-air missile system which is used to protect his own country from enemy attack.

The first part of the game starts with the player in his Crusader Jet and the task is to destroy the enemy fighter. This may be done with the Fighter or using the Ground Based Missile Systems. The Fighter and the Ground Based Systems are linked together so it is possible to control either at any time during this phase of the game. Calling the Ground Based Systems replaces the cockpit controls and allows missiles to be fired at the enemy from the ground. When the ground defenses are in use, the player is unable to control the fighter which will continue at its present velocity until control is regained. Likewise, when in control of the fighter, the player will be unable to employ the Ground Based Systems. The player must also avoid satellites and meteorites coming his way.

The Fighter cockpit shows fuel gauges, radar screen, altitude and speed indicators, temperature gauges and various other instruments. Pressing F1 switches to an overview of the strategic situation on a galactic map. The top of the screen shows the enemy base with the missile silos. The player’s base is at the bottom of the screen. The player's Fighter is shown as a blue triangle and the enemy fighter is shown as a dark blue triangle. Small white dots indicate the missiles that have been fired. A number of meters also indicate the flight altitude of his plane, the enemy plane and indicate the missiles that are speeding through space.

If the enemy craft is successfully destroyed, the player's fighter automatically goes into warp mode and flies to the enemy base. Here the player must attack the enemy base and blow it up. But if the fighter is destroyed, the player must defend his base against enemy attacks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pressing F1 switches to an overview of the strategic situation on a galactic map. The top of the screen shows the enemy base with the missile silos. Your base is at the bottom of the screen.

title: Jet Fighter

description: Kaereltje leert wiskunde: Wiskunde I is an educational game in Dutch for 12 to 15 year olds that focus on the introduction to analytical geometry: working with coordinate systems and indexed points thereon. The program consists of three parts: The first part is theoretical introduction, called vectors. In the second part, the player is quizzed about the material from part 1 by means of optional questions. In the third part, the player is tested on the knowledge acquired on the basis of sums. The sums are also of the multiple choice type, with a choice of three answers each time. Then there is a choice whether a series of 10, 25 or 100 questions can be made. There are three types of sums. Type 1 is filling in the coordinates of a point on a coordinate system. In a sum of the second type, the Pythagorean theorem must be applied. Given the length of two sides of a right triangle, the length of the third side must be calculated. A sum of the third type unites the previous types. Here the distance between two points on a coordinate system must be calculated.
title: Kaereltje leert wiskunde: Wiskunde I

description:
MSX Compilation 1 is the first release in the MSX Compilation series. It contains five games previously released by Aackosoft and Eaglesoft. This compilation includes:

  • Alpha Blaster
  • Jet Fighter
  • Kaereltje leert wiskunde: Wiskunde I
  • Skramble
  • Space Busters
title: MSX Compilation 1

description:
MSX Compilation 3 is the third release in the MSX Compilation series containing four games previously released by Aackosoft and Eaglesoft. This compilation includes:

  • Chuckie Egg
  • Eddie Kidd Jump Challenge
  • Maths Invaders
  • Sorcery
title: MSX Compilation 3

description:
MSX Compilation 4 is the fourth release in the MSX Compilation series containing four games previously released by Aackosoft and Eaglesoft. This compilation includes:

  • Boom!
  • MacAttack
  • Scentipede
  • Space Busters
title: MSX Compilation 4

description:
MSX Compilation 5 is the fifth release in the MSX Compilation series containing four games previously released by Aackosoft and Eaglesoft. This compilation includes:

  • Hopper
  • Kick it!
  • Oh Shit!
  • Space Rescue
title: MSX Compilation 5

description:
MSX Compilation 6 is the sixth release in the MSX Compilation series containing four games previously released by Aackosoft and Eaglesoft. This compilation includes:

  • Ice
  • Moonrider
  • Robot Wars
  • Smack Wacker
title: MSX Compilation 6

description:
Darkwood Manor is a text adventure game in which the player must solve the murder committed in Darkwood Manor, the residence of Lord and Lady Wethermere. The object of the game is to unmask the killer from the clues scattered in the various locations. This can be done by first finding the murder weapon that is hidden somewhere. When it is found the player may question the nine characters that he meets in the manor. Each will tell what he or she was doing at the time of the murder, but one of them is lying. In order to question them, type "QUESTION (CHARACTER)". When the player knows who the murderer is, he can accuse that character of the murder by typing "ACCUSE (CHARACTER)". If all goes well, a reward can be claimed: a fabulous diamond from an Eastern idol, the "Eye of Miradad". However, it must be found first.

The player inputs all actions via verb-noun commands with the keyboard to interact with the surroundings, such as "GET KEY" or "DROP ROPE". To make things simpler, the first three letters of a word may be used. To navigate through the locations in the game use "(N)ORTH", "(S)OUTH", "(E)AST", "(W)EST", "(U)P" and "(D)OWN". Things can be investigated with "EXAMINE" or "LOOK". "INV" will give an inventory of what the player is carrying. "HELP" will give the instructions and "QUIT" will end the game.

Before loading the tape the "CAPS LOCK" must be set to ON. It is possible to save the game at any time ("SAVE"), but make sure to use a blank cassette. Before the game starts, it will give the option to to load a saved game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your Inventory. This is what you have now in your possession.
Before the game starts, it will give the option to to load a saved game.
Title Screen and credits. REMEMBER: Before loading the tape the "CAPS LOCK" must be set to ON.
I walked in a pitch dark room and the murderer has found me! Another tomorrow....remember to walk in the light.

title: Darkwood Manor

description: Puzzle Mania: MSX GOTO 40 Edition is a classic sliding-puzzle game based on images from iconic MSX and MSX2 games released in the 80s and 90s. You choose the game to base the puzzle on, the desired grid-size and then try to solve the sliding puzzle. Grid sizes are available from from 4x4 to 7x7. Pressing "H" during the puzzle screen will show the original picture. ESC returns to the main menu.
title: Puzzle Mania: MSX GOTO 40 Edition

description:
Jackie Chan is the super detective of the South Bronx Precinct of the New York City Police Department. One day, designer Lola is kidnapped from the fashion show venue he was guarding. Jackie follows her to Hong Kong and learns that a drug syndicate is operating behind the scenes. After tracking down the syndicate's drug factory, Jackie sets out to rescue the girl.

Jackie Chan in The Protector is an action platform game inspired by the 1985 Jackie Chan film of the same name. Each stage shows a single screen with several platforms on which two or three enemies with weapons in hand, are waiting for Jackie. Each enemy has a different attack routine. Some will hit with their weapon while they move, like Benny Garucci, a man wearing a jersey top and bottom wielding an electric saw. Others can perform ranged attacks, such as the knife-throwing Bronx Kid (wears pink with a mohawk), Mr. Kō, a nasty looking guy (wears a navy blue top and bottom) who uses a pistol or Kim Taijin (wears a light blue jersey) who throws dynamite everywhere. There is also David Ho who is usually on the upper floor and keeps throwing large boxes. The object of the game is to clear each stage by defeating all the enemies on the screen.

Jackie is able to move left and right, jump, wide jump, crouch, punch, flying kicks and low kicks. Its also possible to use high techniques such as jumping with a run-up or kicking a wall to change the angle of the jump (as Jackie did in the movie). There are also trampolines and hanging rings on the screen that allow Jackie to reach certain areas, such as the upper floors, that cannot be reached by jumping.

Jackie has 3 lives and an energy bar that can withstand up to 5 hits.

sample_screenshots.caption: I have lost all my energy when I kept on getting touched by the Helicopter and it is game over. (Pony. Inc.)
If you get hit five times, you will lose one of your lives. (Pony. Inc.)
Title Screen with Credits and Copyright. (Pony. Inc.)

title: Jackie Chan in The Protector

description: Zipper is a "climber" style game where the player takes the role of the little-known superhero Mr. Zip who is lost on a giant zipper that suddenly starts to close. The aim of the game is to climb to the top of the zipper without getting hit by the advancing buckle. Don't go too far to the left or right, otherwise the player may fall off. The other dangers are broken teeth and falling sewing material. To avoid the broken teeth and the falling sewing material the player must jump from one side of the zipper to the other. The player will score 5 points for each successful jump from one side of the zipper to the other and 100 bonus points for each finished stage. Pressing "P" will pause the game and pressing other keys will resume the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: You must climb to the top of the zipper without getting hit by the advancing buckle. Don't go too far to the left or right, otherwise the player may fall off. The other dangers are broken teeth and falling sewing material.
Title Screen with Copyright  and Credits.

title: Zipper

description:
Coco Castle is an action game in which the player takes the role of Coco (of clown fame) whose fiancée has been kidnapped by the Creepy King. To rescue her he must find the hidden path to the King's Cavern, and survive all the obstacles that are set to trap him. There are ten scenarios and five levels of play (wizard, knight, squire and serf) to choose from. The game consists of ten scenarios:

  1. Creepy Castle: Coco has to avoid the black knight and jump on the moving drawbridge.

  2. Lava Slugs: Jump onto the slugs’ backs, knock down the apples for food to progress onto the next level.

  3. Awful Arrows: Dodge the arrows while grabbing sun shades.

  4. Sharp Spears: Now Coco has to dodge the spears while eating strawberries.

  5. Crumbling Pits: Jump over the pits and eat cherries for strength. Look out for the challenging head-wind.

  6. Cannon-ball-run: Avoid the cannon-balls and a box will rebuild the path.

  7. Leap of Death: Jump onto the moving lava monster that will ferry Coco across the pit while grabbing the diamonds that float on high.

  8. Tree Trolls: Grab a chalice of mead and avoid the flapping trolls.

  9. Deadly Dash: Tread carefully on the vanishing path.

  10. King's Cavern: Before Coco can reach his fiancée, a river, several cannonballs and an archer continuously firing arrows must to be negotiated.

sample_screenshots.caption: Scenario 3: Awful Arrows - Dodge the arrows while grabbing sun shades.
There is five levels of play (wizard, knight, squire and serf) to choose from.
Choose one of the ten scenarios to begin with.

title: Coco Castle

description:
PiPi is an action maze game in which the player takes the role of PiPi, a parrot, who got captured by King Mendama and locked in a maze-like prison in the underground of the Mendarm kingdom. He is so scared of being eaten that he bravely tries to escape from it. When PiPi walks through the maze he leaves footprints, and when the footprints surround a block in the maze, that block collapses. Once all the blocks are destroyed, he can move on to the next scene by slipping in the mouth of the guard dog Bowbow.

The rattlesnakes in the maze who want to eat PiPi are usually blue. However, by eating bonus items like hamburger, persimmon, ice cream, peanut, or fish, he will be powered up for 5 seconds. During that time, the rattlesnakes turn red and PiPi (turning white) can eat them. He also doesn't have to worry about getting hurt from touching Mendama. Also, if PiPi eats a power bread that suddenly appears, all enemies will disappear for a few seconds. When the time limit is below 50% King Mendama will appear and will chase PiPi.

PiPi starts with 5 lives. 1 live will be added for 20,000 points. However, a maximum of 8 lives is allowed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Yikes. One of the snakes got me.

Watch out for the blue rattlesnakes. Eating the bonus characters like the hamburger, persimmon, ice cream, peanut, or fish, he will be powered up for 5 seconds. During that time, the rattlesnakes turn red and PiPi (turning white) can eat them.
Once all the blocks are destroyed, you can move on to the next scene by slipping in the mouth of the guard dog BOWBOW.
....and when the footprints surround a block in the maze, that block collapses.

title: PiPi

description:
Jake a hireling of the Woyswoid is sent to battle the Chryse army who had kidnapped his lover Elriaga a year ago. Using his mecha robot Girly Block, Jake heads to the Chryse Fortress.

The player controls the mecha across multiple stages in the fortress. Each stage requires the player to destroy one or more enemies while platforming and collecting healing power-ups. In some stages, the player can upgrade the mecha with better speed, jumping boost, hit-points and weapons. However some parts can add unwanted weight.
title: Girly Block

description:
Midway is an arcade shoot-em-up set in world war II. You pilot an airplane from a squadron of three, and must take on the ships of the navy below. Your airplane moves at a fixed speed, and may only turn left or right. It can also travel off the screen, with the screen flipping to the new location. A never-ending stream of ships of various types appear from the North and slowly travel South. You can bomb the ships when immediately passing over them, and this will give you points and fuel to continue the attack. Dropping bombs that miss their targets will cost you points.

There are four different types of enemy. The aircraft carrier is the largest, easiest to hit, and worth the least. There are also battleships, armed with anti-aircraft weapons, smaller naval cruisers and submarines which periodically dive below the sea surface. You will lose a plane when hit by anti-aircarft fire, or when running out of fuel. The game is over once the entire squadron is defeated.

sample_screenshots.caption: Bombing one of the three aircraft carriers.

title: Midway

description:
The fourth of Hudson's W series compilations, consisting of:

  • Super Doors
  • Ame no Hi wa Ōisogashi

This is the only release of these two games for the MSX.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen for Ame no Hi wa Ōisogashi
Throwing water at a pesky rodent.

title: Super Doors / Ame no Hi wa Ōisogashi

description:
Comet Tail is a Snake variant for the MSX. It takes place in a rectangular maze containing one blue and one yellow comet, each consisting of a nucleus and a tail. You control one of these comets, with the other under the control of the computer or another player. The comets are constantly on the move, but may turn left or right. Blue and yellow stellar material appears randomly in the arena. Collecting material of your own colour will allow your tail to grow. Collecting material of the other comet's colour will cause its tail to shrink.

Every time you collect any material, a timer resets. If you fail to capture any more material before the timer runs out, your tail will also shrink. You can lose a life if you completely decay, or if you run into the maze walls, your own or your opponent's tail. Play continues until you achieve a certain score, at which point an exit opens up in the outer wall, which will take you to the next arena. There are five speed settings and a total of 50 levels with increasingly complicated wall patterns, making it much more difficult to navigate safely.

sample_screenshots.caption: The yellow comet exits the level.
First level has no internal walls.

title: Comet Tail

description:
Exchanger is an arcade game spanning two parallel universes, separated by a barrier. You control an exchanger, which is a device made of black and white holes that will suck aliens through a tunnel from one universe to an outlet in the other. The device will periodically change the direction of transfer after a short pause in operation. You can directly control the motion of one end of the exchanger, while the other end is controlled indirectly and may move in the opposite direction from the first end. Each level is initially populated with aliens of two types that have appeared in the wrong universes. Your aim is to send all of the aliens home, using the exchanger, so that the blue aliens are on the right side of the barrier while the yellow ones are on the left.

If you exchange an alien twice within a short period of time, it becomes angry and turns a red colour. An angry alien will wreck your exchanger if you touch it with the outlet, causing you to lose a life. Later levels also introduce mines which will detonate after contact with either end of your exchanger.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 1: Swap a single alien from each universe.
Watch out. An alien has become angry,

title: Exchanger

description:
Heavy Boxing is an arcade sports game for one or two players. You control a boxer, and can move around the ring and try to punch your opponent. Landing a successful punch will give you energy, as indicated by a bar at the bottom of the screen. Being hit by your opponent, or ducking a punch will cost you energy. A successful punch will have a chance of knocking down your opponent, after which a timer starts. At any time, there is some likelihood that the boxer gets to their feet and the round continues. But if the boxer does not get back up after 10 seconds, then they lose the game by knock out (KO). A KO will also occur if one of the players loses all of their energy.

Absent a KO, the game will continue for 12 rounds of 90 seconds each. The players regain some of their energy at the end of each round. After all rounds are completed, the game will be adjudicated by the number of hits landed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Human player wins by knock out!
Human player has been knocked down.

title: Heavy Boxing

description:
Pai Panic is a Mahjong themed single screen action game. You play as Jankiki-kun, who is a creature with a hammer. A row of Mahjong tiles starts to appear from the left of the screen. By hitting the ground above a tile, you can knock it onto your rack. If the tile lands on-top of an already placed tile, then it replaces the previous one. Your goal is to collect a full Mahjong hand before the tiles run out. This typically consists of four melds (three of one type, or a run of three consecutive numbers of the same suit) plus a pair.

While you are playing, obstacles bounce around overhead. Depending on the level of difficulty, there may be one or two bouncing dice, or spinning point sticks that can only be avoided by jumping over them. If you are hit by anything, you are temporarily stunned. Hammering a button on the right of the screen will sort all of your tiles, allowing you to more easily assess your hand. Pressing the "ron" button on the left will complete the level if you have a valid hand. Otherwise you lose a life.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hit on the head by a bouncing die.
Jumping to avoid obstacles on Level 4 difficulty.

title: Pai Panic

description:
Little Acorn is a cute single-screen action game by Taito that would not have looked out of place in the arcades but was exclusively released on the MSX.

Starring Sweey, an egg-like hero in red trousers, it needs to clear a magic garden of Peepas, cloud-like creatures who dwell the screen. Peepas can be killed by throwing acorns at them, the novelty here is throwing requires energy. Spinning from left to right very quickly fills an energy gauge; The more energy is build up, the further an acorn is thrown. When a Peepa is hit, it will smash into a wall, destroying anything in its path.

Acorns can bounce off walls and boxes so you can use it as a tactical advantage to score extra points. But beware, you can get hit by your acorn that will cost a life.

Peepas come in six colours, each behaving in a different manner. The most notorious ones are Red Peepas who split in two when hit and Black Peepas who fiercely hunt Sweey when it does not clear the screen fast enough. Another foe that sometimes pops up is Merimeri, a grey rubber ball-shaped creature that does not chase Sweey but is lethal on contact.

An extra life is awarded at 40,000 points, with other extra lives at 80,000 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: On the left is our hero Sweey, on the right Peepas in three different colours.
Throwing an acorn smashes two Peepas in the wall top-right corner.
Merimeri, the grey rubber-ball shaped creature, is difficult to distinguish against the green background.

title: Sweet Acorn
